Dynamic Pricing for Non-fungible Resources: Designing Multidimensional Blockchain Fee Markets

/home/gokul-g-menon/Documents/Projects/Btech Project Final Year/V-LIB/Phase 2/Django-rest-api/api/media/uploads/Dynamic Pricing for Non-fungible Resources: Designing Multidimensional Blockchain Fee Markets.pdf
answer: Consensus algorithms in blockchain are protocols that ensure all nodes in the system agree on the blockchain content. Examples include Proof-of-Work (PoW), used by Bitcoin and Ethereum, which selects a random node to append a block based on computing power, and Practical Byzantine Fault Tolerance (PBFT), used by Hyperledger, which uses a communication-bound protocol to tolerate failures. Hybrid designs, such as Bitcoin-NG and Tendermint, combine the scalability of PoW with the safety property of PBFT.
